intro: Tritonixia squalida, commonly known as the dirty tritonixia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Tritonixia squalida thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
